Many Incapable of Thinking for Themselves. --There are many families of children who appear to be well trained while under the training discipline; but 


                                                    283 

when the system which has held them to set rules is broken up, they seem to be incapable of thinking, acting, or deciding for themselves. These children have been so long under iron rule--not allowed to think and act for themselves in those things in which it was highly proper that they should--that they have no confidence in themselves to move out upon their own judgment, having an opinion of their own.
